definition[0]: the small group of people that are most active within a group or organization
example[0]: the hard core of the Communist Party
definition[1]: a group of people who cannot be persuaded to change their behaviour or beliefs
example[1]: There is still a small hard core of football supporters who cause trouble whenever they can.
definition[2]: having an extreme way of life or an extreme belief that is very unlikely to change
definition[3]: those who are most involved or active in something, or who support something very strongly
example[4]: There is a hard core of users for videoconferencing, but it is certainly not a mass medium.
